byline.original: By MIKE ISAAC and NOAM SCHEIBER

abstract: Uber files motion in California court to oppose certification of class-action lawsuit over drivers' work status; plaintiffs maintain they are employees.
lead_paragraph: The ride-hailing service asserts that the handful of drivers who filed the lawsuit on work status shouldn’t represent all the drivers.

headline.main: Uber Files Motion Opposing Driver Class-Action Suit
headline.print_headline: Uber Delivers Response to a Class-Action Lawsuit Over Drivers’ Work Status

snippet: The ride-hailing service asserts that the handful of drivers who filed the lawsuit on work status shouldn’t represent all the drivers.
